place.name: SWATON
place.gazetteerText: SWATON, a parish, with a village, in Sleaford district, Lincoln; 4¼ miles S of Heckington r. station, and 5 NE by E of Falkingham. Post town, Falkingham. Acres, 3,670. Real property, £5,184. Pop., 297. Houses, 51. The manor belongs to the Rev. H. Lee Warner. The living is a vicarage, united with Spanby, in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £515.* Patron, Mrs. Ram. The church is old but good. There is a parochial school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
